intro: Barleria fasciculata, commonly known as redstem barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and a distinctive reddish hue. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or red, clustered in dense spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
